decisions.reasoning: SDK-301 failure at score 35 caused 15 supervisor conflicts and 15 CEO escalations - clear evidence of cascade failure. Clipboard APIs are notoriously complex with browser quirks. Task decomposition follows proven pattern from learnings.md.
conditions: Root cause analysis must include full supervisor rejection logs
If decomposition is needed, create 3 separate tasks max
Update learnings.md with browser API complexity guidelines
cascade_orders: All agents: Complex browser APIs must be decomposed into atomic tasks
Skills agent: Update task creation guidelines for browser utilities

decisions.reasoning: Score 48 is dangerously low for auto-approval. Blind retries waste MiniMax calls and risk over-correction degradation. Quality threshold prevents low-quality code from shipping.
conditions: Set threshold at score < 60 triggers human review
Log all borderline passes (60-70) for trend analysis
Implement rollback if threshold causes excessive human reviews
cascade_orders: Supervisor: Implement quality threshold before auto-retry
All agents: Scores below 60 require explanation in commit message

decisions.reasoning: Frontend consistency (93-98%) vs backend-core volatility (35-48%) suggests structural prompt differences. If frontend patterns are superior, we can eliminate the 11% rejection delta across all backend agents.
conditions: Analysis must include specific prompt template comparisons
Test any prompt changes on sandbox tasks first
Document findings in learnings.md before implementing
cascade_orders: If frontend prompts prove superior: Update all backend agent prompts
Skills agent: Standardize prompt templates across similar agent types
